newsitem.title: GREECE: PRESS DIGEST - GREEK GENERAL NEWS- MARCH 17.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - GREEK GENERAL NEWS- MARCH 17.

text.p: Leading stories in the Greek general press:

--New dangers are apparent in Albania as extremists find themselves in possession of arms. Desperate Albanians rushed a Greek gunboat evacuating foreign nationals at Durres over the weekend, a precursor of a new wave of illegal immigration.

--Returning to classrooms today for the first time after their eight-week strike, teachers are objecting to plans to extend the school year and offering alternatives to make up for lost lessons and lost wages.

--Foreign Minister Theodoros Pangalos left no room for doubt when responding to German Foreign Minister Klaus Kinkel's question of whether Greece would allow Turkey funds under the Fourth Financial Protocol. "No, no, no," he said.
--Teachers believe measures announced by the education ministry cannot make up for lost time and will meet today to formulate their own proposals.
--A recent opinion poll shows conservative opposition deputy Kostas Karamanlis leading the field in the run-up to the crucial New Democracy congress on Friday.

--A leading New Democracy deputy sees the danger of a split in the main opposition party in the event incumbent Miltiades Evert or Karamanlis are elected to the post of leader. --Maria Petrakis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
